_comment: MVVM for AI-driven code generation. CRITICAL: Animation in @State (View), NOT ViewModel @Published

mvvm_overview.description: Model-View-ViewModel pattern with ObservableObject for reactive state management
mvvm_overview.data_flow: User interaction → ViewModel method → Update @Published state → View refresh
benefits_for_ai: Simple structure (ViewModel + View, vs 5 files in some other patterns)
Explicit methods (no Action enum to manage)
mvvm_overview.key_principle: Animation state in @State (View), Business state in ViewModel @Published

viewmodel_component.purpose: Manages business state and handles user actions
must_rules: Contain business state ONLY (no UI/animation transient state)
Provide public methods for user actions
must_not_rules: Import UIKit or SwiftUI (pure Swift + Combine only)

view_component.critical_rule: Animation state in @State (View), Business state in ViewModel @Published
must_rules: Use @State for UI/animation state (separate from ViewModel)
Call ViewModel methods for user actions

animation_pattern.flow: ViewModel @Published updates → View.onChange() detects → withAnimation {} updates @State → SwiftUI animates

async_patterns.description: Use async/await for asynchronous operations in ViewModel methods

async_methods.when: One-shot operations (login, fetch data, submit form)

viewstate_pattern.description: OPTIONAL: Presentation Model pattern where ViewModel exposes single ViewState struct
when_to_use: Want to test rendering logic in ViewModel tests
Need to optimize SwiftUI updates with Equatable
benefits: View becomes simple renderer (no mapping logic)
Single source of truth for View rendering

navigation_patterns.description: Navigation in MVVM: intent-based (default), Navigator injection (sparingly), Coordinator (complex flows)
navigation_patterns.recommended_approach: Intent-based navigation (ViewModel emits intent, View executes)

intent_based.description: ViewModel publishes navigation intent; View observes and executes

navigator_injection.description: ViewModel injects Navigator protocol for imperative navigation
navigator_injection.when: Use sparingly when intent-based feels cumbersome
navigator_injection.warning: Use weak reference to avoid retain cycles. Keep Navigator presentation-only (no business logic).

navigation_patterns.see_also: navigation_patterns.json for detailed guide with testing and best practices

viewmodel: ✓ Provides public methods for user actions
✓ Uses async methods for asynchronous operations
view: ✓ Calls ViewModel methods via Task for async

common_mistakes: ❌ Putting animation state in ViewModel @Published (60fps jank)
❌ Not using weak self in closures (memory leaks)
❌ Forgetting to update @Published on MainActor in async methods
